Dear Sir:
Your letter of August 12tb. was laid
aside for reply after I had received word of
acceptance or rejection of the radio progra
The Friendly Philosopher. Having had no in¬
dication of the committee's reaction, I now
feel I should write you anyway.
Your letter stated that neither your
association nor its member stations can assume
any costs in obtaining these programs. In turn,
I am puzzled— hov^ do the producers who supply
your shows pay for them? Are they privately en¬
dowed? Or are all these replays of shows which
were originally sponsored? I had assumed that
your group was backed or sponsored by a founda¬
tion, which assumption appears false. If you can
spare the time for a line or two, please en¬
lighten me.
Of course, your committee may find the
program unsuitable,in which case our discussion
is academic.
Thank you for your courtesy. I diall
look for the return of my tape and script,and,
if possible, a note from you.
Yours sincerely
Gene von Hallberg
for Harmony Hall,Inc.
